Engineering Masterclass for Myself Perspectives On Networks, Automation, Systems, and Software Engineering https://keepingitclassless.net/ Hello World - Welcome to My Blog! <h1 id="hello-world">Hello World!</h1> <p>Welcome to my blog! This is my first post, and Iâ€™m excited to share my thoughts and experiences with you.</p> <h2 id="about-this-blog">About This Blog</h2> <p>This blog is powered by <a href="https://jekyllrb.com/">Jekyll</a>, a static site generator thatâ€™s perfect for creating fast, secure, and easy-to-maintain blogs. Itâ€™s hosted on GitHub Pages, making it completely free and automatically deployed whenever I make changes.</p> <h2 id="how-to-use-this-blog">How to Use This Blog</h2> <p>If youâ€™re interested in creating your own posts on this blog, hereâ€™s how it works:</p> <h3 id="creating-new-posts">Creating New Posts</h3> <ol> <li><strong>File Location</strong>: All blog posts are stored in the <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">_posts/</code> directory</li> <li><strong>File Naming</strong>: Posts must follow the naming convention: <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">YYYY-MM-DD-title.markdown</code></li> <li><strong>Front Matter</strong>: Each post must start with YAML front matter (the content between the <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">---</code> lines)</li> </ol> <h3 id="post-structure">Post Structure</h3> <p>Hereâ€™s the basic structure of a blog post:</p> <div class="language-markdown highlighter-rouge"><div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight"><code><span class="nn">---</span> <span class="na">layout</span><span class="pi">:</span> <span class="s">post</span> <span class="na">title</span><span class="pi">:</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="s">Your</span><span class="nv"> </span><span class="s">Post</span><span class="nv"> </span><span class="s">Title"</span> <span class="na">date</span><span class="pi">:</span> <span class="s">YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS</span> <span class="na">categories</span><span class="pi">:</span> <span class="pi">[</span><span class="nv">category1</span><span class="pi">,</span> <span class="nv">category2</span><span class="pi">]</span> <span class="na">tags</span><span class="pi">:</span> <span class="pi">[</span><span class="nv">tag1</span><span class="pi">,</span> <span class="nv">tag2</span><span class="pi">,</span> <span class="nv">tag3</span><span class="pi">]</span> <span class="na">description</span><span class="pi">:</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="s">A</span><span class="nv"> </span><span class="s">brief</span><span class="nv"> </span><span class="s">description</span><span class="nv"> </span><span class="s">of</span><span class="nv"> </span><span class="s">your</span><span class="nv"> </span><span class="s">post"</span> <span class="nn">---</span> <span class="gh"># Your Content Here</span> Write your blog post content using Markdown syntax. <span class="gu">## Subheadings</span> You can use various Markdown features: <span class="p"> -</span> <span class="gs">**Bold text**</span> <span class="p">-</span> <span class="ge">*Italic text*</span> <span class="p">-</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="nv">Links</span><span class="p">](</span><span class="sx">https://example.com</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">-</span> Code blocks <span class="p">-</span> Lists <span class="p">-</span> And much more! </code></pre></div></div> <h3 id="publishing-posts">Publishing Posts</h3> <ol> <li>Create your new post file in the <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">_posts/</code> directory</li> <li>Add and commit your changes to git</li> <li>Push to the GitHub repository</li> <li>GitHub Pages will automatically build and deploy your blog</li> </ol> <h3 id="markdown-tips">Markdown Tips</h3> <p>This blog supports full Markdown syntax, including:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Headers</strong> using <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">#</code>, <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">##</code>, <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">###</code>, etc.</li> <li><strong>Lists</strong> using <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">-</code> or <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">1.</code></li> <li><strong>Code blocks</strong> using triple backticks</li> <li><strong>Links</strong> using <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">[text](url)</code></li> <li><strong>Images</strong> using <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">![alt text](image-url)</code></li> <li><strong>Bold</strong> using <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">**text**</code></li> <li><strong>Italic</strong> using <code class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">*text*</code></li> </ul> <h2 id="getting-started">Getting Started</h2> <p>Ready to start blogging? Here are some ideas for your next post:</p> <ol> <li>Share your thoughts on a topic youâ€™re passionate about</li> <li>Write a tutorial or how-to guide</li> <li>Document your learning journey</li> <li>Review a book, tool, or technology</li> <li>Share your personal experiences and insights</li> </ol> <h2 id="contact--social">Contact &amp; Social</h2> <p>Feel free to reach out if you have any questions about this blog or want to connect!</p> <p>Happy blogging! ðŸŽ‰</p> Tue, 31 Dec 2024 07:00:00 -0800 https://keepingitclassless.net/2024/12/hello-world/ https://keepingitclassless.net/2024/12/hello-world/
